CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Burned in Yard Fire - Lorraine Beverly Williams, 7, is comforted by Mrs. Genevieve Buzard, head nurse in South Side Hospital, after she received second and third degree burns of the arms, legs and body Friday as the result of throwing paper into an old coal stove, used as a home-made incinerator, in backyard of her home at 518 Hallock St., Mount Washington. Her mother rushed to her rescue. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Burn victim Lorraine Beverly Williams, wearing traffic patterned pajamas and holding doll, lying in bed in South Side Hospital
